file_content.text: I have nothing more for you--but I promise, the heretics will be destroyed.
The clever slave-turned-master. You return from having your ears filled with lies by the Revanites. I do not envy you the experience.
The master of the lightsaber returns. It must have taken great willpower to leave the Revanite cultists alive long enough to investigate them.
Ah, the subtle, silent agent. I am sorry you had to see Sith so weak as the Revanites.
Ah, the problem solver returns from the Revanite heretics.
Ah, my ally returns from the Revanite heretics.
Tell me now: Did you find what we need? Did you see the face of the leader?
She's a Sith Lord. Dark-skinned, with black hair and tattoos.
I met her.
I know her... I know her! Yes.
Tari Darkspanner. My master knows her. We will use her. The Dark Council will strip her of her power, her mind and her life.
I understand.
The Master and her followers can still be rehabilitated.
Show mercy.
You speak with the weakness of one who has spent too long in the order. But I will consider it a momentary lapse.
Whatever you can do to her and her people, it isn't enough.
She deserves worse.
Likely true. But I'm sure the punishment will suffice.
I promised you a reward in the name of Darth Charnus. So you shall have it--you have served the Empire well.
Thanks to you, we have the means to obliterate this society of heretics. The name of Revan will be spoken on Dromund Kaas no more.
Very well.
The order was too weak to survive for long.
The outcome was inevitable.
All history is eventually devoured by darkness.
The outcome was inevitable.
You speak truly.
It was necessary.
Of course.
That wasn't so bad.
A pity it went this way.
Better to snuff out the plague than to let it spread.
Leave me now. It is time to put Darth Charnus's plans into action.
It was a man. I couldn't learn his name, but he wore this amulet.
[Lie] I met him.
Oh? Perhaps that will be enough. A symbol of rank, or affiliation, or--
This. I know this amulet! How did you obtain it?
I don't need to tell you the story. You can figure it out.
How do you think?
Call it diplomacy.
I obtained it at great personal risk. I hope it was worth it.
It wasn't easy.
This is the amulet of my master Darth Charnus. Taken from the Order of Revan....
Speak to no one of this. I will deal with my master myself.
I'll leave you to it, then.
As you like.
Oh?
It would harm you to know. What happens next must be swift and silent.
Your master is a traitor and should die. There is no alternative.
You must kill him.
Perhaps. But any punishment needs to be swift and silent. And you will not be involved.
Your master's heresies cannot be allowed to endure.
He must not continue.
I agree. But that is all I will say for now.
Let me know if you need the help of Imperial Intelligence.
My people could assist.
I could deal with him for you, if you want.
Need any help?
No! That is unnecessary.
Take your payment from my own keepings. It is all I can offer you without alerting Darth Charnus.
Leave now. We cannot be seen together any longer, and I have much to do.
May the Order of Revan soon be destroyed... along with all the enemies of the Empire.
Death to the Revanites!
Yes. Death to all who oppose us.
Hope it goes well.
You've done well. Now go... and beware of Charnus.
This is over forever.
Agreed. It would only complicate matters.
My master must know the identity of the Revanite leader.
It is rare for a slave to rise so far, so fast. That takes a very clever sort.
Already you move through the Citadel as if it were yours. Perhaps someday it will be.
I know of you. You work quietly and tell no secrets.
Ah, mercenary. Already word of your feats has reached those knowledgeable in Kaas City.
Ah. The stranger. Word is already spreading about you.
I am the apprentice and voice of Darth Charnus. I speak in his name, and I would bargain for your services.
I've never heard of any "Darth Charnus."
Darth Charnus?
Go on.
If your master needs me, he can come to me himself.
I don't deal with servants.
My master prefers to remain in the shadows, but do not doubt his power--nor his ability to reward success. I speak for him.
I require individuals capable of gaining prestige in a society weaned on secrecy and madness. Individuals who can earn... respect, if not love.
I need infiltrators to eliminate an enemy of the Sith. You would serve well.
All enemies of the Sith will die before me.
I'll begin the slaughter.
An enemy of the Sith is one thing. An enemy of your master is another.
This isn't just your vendetta?
Sounds like a job.
If you like.
What sort of enemy are you referring to?
I need more information.
Shouldn't you consult with Imperial Intelligence first?
I have other missions.
My authorization comes from a different source. I do not need permission from the Minister of Intelligence.
I serve no one. I suggest you learn that quickly.
I am no servant.
I chose my words poorly. I apologize. But you are needed.
Our enemy is the Order of Revan--a cult of fools hidden at every stratum of Imperial society.
For years, the Revanite heretics have secretly recruited military officers, powerful Sith, wealthy mercenaries--anyone who can add to their power.
You want me to join them, I take it?
So I'm to be recruited?
I want you to help my master ruin them.
What makes them heretics?
Heretics?
If they're secret, how do you know anything about them?
They're no good at secrets.
My master has spent many years learning of the Revanites. Together, we have exposed many.
Instead of following the Emperor and his Dark Council, the Revanites follow a long-dead Sith Lord tainted by Jedi ways.
But we can purge this secret society and their teachings from Dromund Kaas. All we need is the identity of their leader.
Keep talking.
I don't understand.
What if I don't want the Revanites purged?
And if I disagree?
You think they might prove useful? No. Their positions of power make them too dangerous.
If you can uncover the Revanite leader's identity for us, my master will reveal him to the Dark Council. His destruction would be assured.
All you have to do is join the cult. I can get you inside, but you must earn their trust.
I will earn more than their trust. I will earn their fear.
They'll be forced to comply.
That may be enough.
I'm sure they'll take to me immediately.
I get on well with people.
How?
Not a problem.
I earn their trust, I earn my fee--is that right?
So long as you're paying.
Indeed.
You haven't earned my trust, yet.
I don't like this.
You're making a mistake. My master will richly reward your success--not to mention the satisfaction you'll gain.
Very well.
I wouldn't mind seeing some blood shed.
If there's violence, perhaps.
The Revanites have a secret compound in the jungle. Take this token to the cultist at the entrance. He will initiate you.
Earn an audience with their leader. When you have seen his face, return here--and you shall have your reward.
We're through. [Refuse quest]
You are resolved, then. Very well. Darth Charnus will not be pleased.
I have no need of you. Not yet.
